add_comment_to_pending_review.name: add_comment_to_pending_review
add_comment_to_pending_review.description: Add review comment to the requester's latest pending pull request review. A pending review needs to already exist to call this (check with the user if not sure).

body.description: The text of the review comment

line.description: The line of the blob in the pull request diff that the comment applies to. For multi-line comments, the last line of the range

path.description: The relative path to the file that necessitates a comment

side.description: The side of the diff to comment on. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

startLine.description: For multi-line comments, the first line of the range that the comment applies to

startSide.description: For multi-line comments, the starting side of the diff that the comment applies to. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

subjectType.description: The level at which the comment is targeted

add_issue_comment.name: add_issue_comment
add_issue_comment.description: Add a comment to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

add_sub_issue.name: add_sub_issue
add_sub_issue.description: Add a sub-issue to a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

replace_parent.description: When true, replaces the sub-issue's current parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to add. ID is not the same as issue number

assign_copilot_to_issue.name: assign_copilot_to_issue
assign_copilot_to_issue.description:
Assign Copilot to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

This tool can help with the following outcomes:
- a Pull Request created with source code changes to resolve the issue


More information can be found at:
- https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/using-copilot-coding-agent-to-work-on-tasks/about-assigning-tasks-to-copilot

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

create_and_submit_pull_request_review.name: create_and_submit_pull_request_review
create_and_submit_pull_request_review.description: Create and submit a review for a pull request without review comments.

create_branch.name: create_branch
create_branch.description: Create a new branch in a GitHub repository

content.description: Content for simple single-file gist creation

filename.description: Filename for simple single-file gist creation

create_issue.name: create_issue
create_issue.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository.

assignees.description: Usernames to assign to this issue

labels.description: Labels to apply to this issue

create_or_update_file.name: create_or_update_file
create_or_update_file.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository. If updating, you must provide the SHA of the file you want to update. Use this tool to create or update a file in a GitHub repository remotely; do not use it for local file operations.

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

sha.description: Required if updating an existing file. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

create_pending_pull_request_review.name: create_pending_pull_request_review
create_pending_pull_request_review.description: Create a pending review for a pull request. Call this first before attempting to add comments to a pending review, and ultimately submitting it. A pending pull request review means a pull request review, it is pending because you create it first and submit it later, and the PR author will not see it until it is submitted.

create_pull_request.name: create_pull_request
create_pull_request.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository.

create_pull_request_with_copilot.name: create_pull_request_with_copilot
create_pull_request_with_copilot.description: Delegate a task to GitHub Copilot coding agent to perform in the background. The agent will create a pull request with the implementation. You should use this tool if the user asks to create a pull request to perform a specific task, or if the user asks Copilot to do something.

base_ref.description: Git reference (e.g., branch) that the agent will start its work from. If not specified, defaults to the repository's default branch

owner.description: Repository owner. You can guess the owner, but confirm it with the user before proceeding.

problem_statement.description: Detailed description of the task to be performed (e.g., 'Implement a feature that does X', 'Fix bug Y', etc.)

repo.description: Repository name. You can guess the repository name, but confirm it with the user before proceeding.

title.description: Title for the pull request that will be created

create_repository.name: create_repository
create_repository.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account or specified organization

organization.description: Organization to create the repository in (omit to create in your personal account)

delete_file.name: delete_file
delete_file.description: Delete a file from a GitHub repository

branch.description: Branch to delete the file from

path.description: Path to the file to delete

delete_pending_pull_request_review.name: delete_pending_pull_request_review
delete_pending_pull_request_review.description: Delete the requester's latest pending pull request review. Use this after the user decides not to submit a pending review, if you don't know if they already created one then check first.

delete_workflow_run_logs.name: delete_workflow_run_logs
delete_workflow_run_logs.description: Delete logs for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

dismiss_notification.name: dismiss_notification
dismiss_notification.description: Dismiss a notification by marking it as read or done

state.description: The new state of the notification (read/done)

threadID.description: The ID of the notification thread

download_workflow_run_artifact.name: download_workflow_run_artifact
download_workflow_run_artifact.description: Get download URL for a workflow run artifact

artifact_id.description: The unique identifier of the artifact

fork_repository.name: fork_repository
fork_repository.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization

get_code_scanning_alert.name: get_code_scanning_alert
get_code_scanning_alert.description: Get details of a specific code scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

get_commit.name: get_commit
get_commit.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

include_diff.description: Whether to include file diffs and stats in the response. Default is true.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch name, or tag name

get_dependabot_alert.name: get_dependabot_alert
get_dependabot_alert.description: Get details of a specific dependabot alert in a GitHub repository.

get_discussion.name: get_discussion
get_discussion.description: Get a specific discussion by ID

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_file_contents.name: get_file_contents
get_file_contents.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

path.description: Path to file/directory (directories must end with a slash '/')

ref.description: Accepts optional git refs such as `refs/tags/{tag}`, `refs/heads/{branch}` or `refs/pull/{pr_number}/head`

sha.description: Accepts optional commit SHA. If specified, it will be used instead of ref

get_issue.name: get_issue
get_issue.description: Get details of a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

get_issue_comments.name: get_issue_comments
get_issue_comments.description: Get comments for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_job_logs.name: get_job_logs
get_job_logs.description: Download logs for a specific workflow job or efficiently get all failed job logs for a workflow run

failed_only.description: When true, gets logs for all failed jobs in run_id

job_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow job (required for single job logs)

return_content.description: Returns actual log content instead of URLs

run_id.description: Workflow run ID (required when using failed_only)

tail_lines.description: Number of lines to return from the end of the log

get_latest_release.name: get_latest_release
get_latest_release.description: Get the latest release in a GitHub repository

get_me.name: get_me
get_me.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request is about the user's own profile for GitHub. Or when information is missing to build other tool calls.

get_notification_details.name: get_notification_details
get_notification_details.description: Get detailed information for a specific GitHub notification, always call this tool when the user asks for details about a specific notification, if you don't know the ID list notifications first.

get_pull_request.name: get_pull_request
get_pull_request.description: Get details of a specific pull request in a GitHub repository.

get_pull_request_diff.name: get_pull_request_diff
get_pull_request_diff.description: Get the diff of a pull request.

get_pull_request_files.name: get_pull_request_files
get_pull_request_files.description: Get the files changed in a specific pull request.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_pull_request_review_comments.name: get_pull_request_review_comments
get_pull_request_review_comments.description: Get pull request review comments. They are comments made on a portion of the unified diff during a pull request review. These are different from commit comments and issue comments in a pull request.

get_pull_request_reviews.name: get_pull_request_reviews
get_pull_request_reviews.description: Get reviews for a specific pull request.

get_pull_request_status.name: get_pull_request_status
get_pull_request_status.description: Get the status of a specific pull request.

get_release_by_tag.name: get_release_by_tag
get_release_by_tag.description: Get a specific release by its tag name in a GitHub repository

get_secret_scanning_alert.name: get_secret_scanning_alert
get_secret_scanning_alert.description: Get details of a specific secret scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

get_tag.name: get_tag
get_tag.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

get_team_members.name: get_team_members
get_team_members.description: Get member usernames of a specific team in an organization. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

org.description: Organization login (owner) that contains the team.

get_teams.name: get_teams
get_teams.description: Get details of the teams the user is a member of. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

user.description: Username to get teams for. If not provided, uses the authenticated user.

get_workflow_run.name: get_workflow_run
get_workflow_run.description: Get details of a specific workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

get_workflow_run_logs.name: get_workflow_run_logs
get_workflow_run_logs.description: Download logs for a specific workflow run (EXPENSIVE: downloads ALL logs as ZIP. Consider using get_job_logs with failed_only=true for debugging failed jobs)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

get_workflow_run_usage.name: get_workflow_run_usage
get_workflow_run_usage.description: Get usage metrics for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_branches.name: list_branches
list_branches.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_code_scanning_alerts.name: list_code_scanning_alerts
list_code_scanning_alerts.description: List code scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

ref.description: The Git reference for the results you want to list.

severity.description: Filter code scanning alerts by severity

state.description: Filter code scanning alerts by state. Defaults to open

tool_name.description: The name of the tool used for code scanning.

list_commits.name: list_commits
list_commits.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository. Returns at least 30 results per page by default, but can return more if specified using the perPage parameter (up to 100).

author.description: Author username or email address to filter commits by

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch or tag name to list commits of. If not provided, uses the default branch of the repository. If a commit SHA is provided, will list commits up to that SHA.

list_dependabot_alerts.name: list_dependabot_alerts
list_dependabot_alerts.description: List dependabot alerts in a GitHub repository.

state.description: Filter dependabot alerts by state. Defaults to open

list_discussion_categories.name: list_discussion_categories
list_discussion_categories.description: List discussion categories with their id and name, for a repository or organisation.

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussion categories will be queried at the organisation level.

list_discussions.name: list_discussions
list_discussions.description: List discussions for a repository or organisation.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

category.description: Optional filter by discussion category ID. If provided, only discussions with this category are listed.

orderBy.description: Order discussions by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussions will be queried at the organisation level.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

since.description: Only gists updated after this time (ISO 8601 timestamp)

username.description: GitHub username (omit for authenticated user's gists)

list_global_security_advisories.name: list_global_security_advisories
list_global_security_advisories.description: List global security advisories from GitHub.

affects.description: Filter advisories by affected package or version (e.g. "package1,package2@1.0.0").

cwes.description: Filter by Common Weakness Enumeration IDs (e.g. ["79", "284", "22"]).

ghsaId.description: Filter by GitHub Security Advisory ID (format: GHSA-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx).

isWithdrawn.description: Whether to only return withdrawn advisories.

modified.description: Filter by publish or update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

published.description: Filter by publish date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

updated.description: Filter by update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

list_issue_types.name: list_issue_types
list_issue_types.description: List supported issue types for repository owner (organization).

owner.description: The organization owner of the repository

list_issues.name: list_issues
list_issues.description: List issues in a GitHub repository. For pagination, use the 'endCursor' from the previous response's 'pageInfo' in the 'after' parameter.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

direction.description: Order direction. If provided, the 'orderBy' also needs to be provided.

orderBy.description: Order issues by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

state.description: Filter by state, by default both open and closed issues are returned when not provided

list_notifications.name: list_notifications
list_notifications.description: Lists all GitHub notifications for the authenticated user, including unread notifications, mentions, review requests, assignments, and updates on issues or pull requests. Use this tool whenever the user asks what to work on next, requests a summary of their GitHub activity, wants to see pending reviews, or needs to check for new updates or tasks. This tool is the primary way to discover actionable items, reminders, and outstanding work on GitHub. Always call this tool when asked what to work on next, what is pending, or what needs attention in GitHub.

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time (ISO 8601 format)

filter.description: Filter notifications to, use default unless specified. Read notifications are ones that have already been acknowledged by the user. Participating notifications are those that the user is directly involved in, such as issues or pull requests they have commented on or created.

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are listed.

since.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time (ISO 8601 format)

list_org_repository_security_advisories.name: list_org_repository_security_advisories
list_org_repository_security_advisories.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub organization.

list_pull_requests.name: list_pull_requests
list_pull_requests.description: List pull requests in a GitHub repository. If the user specifies an author, then DO NOT use this tool and use the search_pull_requests tool instead.

head.description: Filter by head user/org and branch

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_releases.name: list_releases
list_releases.description: List releases in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_repository_security_advisories.name: list_repository_security_advisories
list_repository_security_advisories.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub repository.

list_secret_scanning_alerts.name: list_secret_scanning_alerts
list_secret_scanning_alerts.description: List secret scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

secret_type.description: A comma-separated list of secret types to return. All default secret patterns are returned. To return generic patterns, pass the token name(s) in the parameter.

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sort.description: How to sort the results. Can be either 'created' (when the repository was starred) or 'updated' (when the repository was last pushed to).

username.description: Username to list starred repositories for. Defaults to the authenticated user.

list_sub_issues.name: list_sub_issues
list_sub_issues.description: List sub-issues for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

per_page.description: Number of results per page (max 100, default: 30)

list_tags.name: list_tags
list_tags.description: List git tags in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_workflow_jobs.name: list_workflow_jobs
list_workflow_jobs.description: List jobs for a specific workflow run

filter.description: Filters jobs by their completed_at timestamp

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_workflow_run_artifacts.name: list_workflow_run_artifacts
list_workflow_run_artifacts.description: List artifacts for a workflow run

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_workflow_runs.name: list_workflow_runs
list_workflow_runs.description: List workflow runs for a specific workflow

actor.description: Returns someone's workflow runs. Use the login for the user who created the workflow run.

branch.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch.

event.description: Returns workflow runs for a specific event type

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

status.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run status

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID or workflow file name

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

manage_notification_subscription.name: manage_notification_subscription
manage_notification_subscription.description: Manage a notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete a notification thread subscription.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the notification subscription.

notificationID.description: The ID of the notification thread.

manage_repository_notification_subscript.name: manage_repository_notification_subscription
manage_repository_notification_subscript.description: Manage a repository notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete repository notifications subscription for the provided repository.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the repository notification subscription.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository.

lastReadAt.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked (optional). Default: Now

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

merge_pull_request.name: merge_pull_request
merge_pull_request.description: Merge a pull request in a GitHub repository.

push_files.name: push_files
push_files.description: Push multiple files to a GitHub repository in a single commit

files.description: Array of file objects to push, each object with path (string) and content (string)

remove_sub_issue.name: remove_sub_issue
remove_sub_issue.description: Remove a sub-issue from a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to remove. ID is not the same as issue number

reprioritize_sub_issue.name: reprioritize_sub_issue
reprioritize_sub_issue.description: Reprioritize a sub-issue to a different position in the parent issue's sub-issue list.

after_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized after (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

before_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized before (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to reprioritize. ID is not the same as issue number

request_copilot_review.name: request_copilot_review
request_copilot_review.description: Request a GitHub Copilot code review for a pull request. Use this for automated feedback on pull requests, usually before requesting a human reviewer.

rerun_failed_jobs.name: rerun_failed_jobs
rerun_failed_jobs.description: Re-run only the failed jobs in a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run
The unique identifier of the workflow run

run_workflow.name: run_workflow
run_workflow.description: Run an Actions workflow by workflow ID or filename

ref.description: The git reference for the workflow. The reference can be a branch or tag name.

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID (numeric) or workflow file name (e.g., main.yml, ci.yaml)

search_code.name: search_code
search_code.description: Fast and precise code search across ALL GitHub repositories using GitHub's native search engine. Best for finding exact symbols, functions, classes, or specific code patterns.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub's powerful code search syntax. Examples: 'content:Skill language:Java org:github', 'NOT is:archived language:Python OR language:go', 'repo:github/github-mcp-server'. Supports exact matching, language filters, path filters, and more.

search_issues.name: search_issues
search_issues.description: Search for issues in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:issue

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only issues for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub issues search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only issues for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

search_orgs.name: search_orgs
search_orgs.description: Find GitHub organizations by name, location, or other organization metadata. Ideal for discovering companies, open source foundations, or teams.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Organization search query. Examples: 'microsoft', 'location:california', 'created:>=2025-01-01'. Search is automatically scoped to type:org.

search_pull_requests.name: search_pull_requests
search_pull_requests.description: Search for pull requests in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:pr

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub pull request search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

search_repositories.name: search_repositories
search_repositories.description: Find GitHub repositories by name, description, readme, topics, or other metadata. Perfect for discovering projects, finding examples, or locating specific repositories across GitHub.

minimal_output.description: Return minimal repository information (default: true). When false, returns full GitHub API repository objects.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Repository search query. Examples: 'machine learning in:name stars:>1000 language:python', 'topic:react', 'user:facebook'. Supports advanced search syntax for precise filtering.

search_users.name: search_users
search_users.description: Find GitHub users by username, real name, or other profile information. Useful for locating developers, contributors, or team members.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: User search query. Examples: 'john smith', 'location:seattle', 'followers:>100'. Search is automatically scoped to type:user.

sort.description: Sort users by number of followers or repositories, or when the person joined GitHub.

submit_pending_pull_request_review.name: submit_pending_pull_request_review
submit_pending_pull_request_review.description: Submit the requester's latest pending pull request review, normally this is a final step after creating a pending review, adding comments first, unless you know that the user already did the first two steps, you should check before calling this.

body.description: The text of the review comment

gist_id.description: ID of the gist to update

update_issue.name: update_issue
update_issue.description: Update an existing issue in a GitHub repository.

duplicate_of.description: Issue number that this issue is a duplicate of. Only used when state_reason is 'duplicate'.

state_reason.description: Reason for the state change. Ignored unless state is changed.

update_pull_request.name: update_pull_request
update_pull_request.description: Update an existing pull request in a GitHub repository.

draft.description: Mark pull request as draft (true) or ready for review (false)

reviewers.description: GitHub usernames to request reviews from

update_pull_request_branch.name: update_pull_request_branch
update_pull_request_branch.description: Update the branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch.

expectedHeadSha.description: The expected SHA of the pull request's HEAD ref

add_comment_to_pending_review.name: add_comment_to_pending_review
add_comment_to_pending_review.description: Add review comment to the requester's latest pending pull request review. A pending review needs to already exist to call this (check with the user if not sure).

body.description: The text of the review comment

line.description: The line of the blob in the pull request diff that the comment applies to. For multi-line comments, the last line of the range

path.description: The relative path to the file that necessitates a comment

side.description: The side of the diff to comment on. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

startLine.description: For multi-line comments, the first line of the range that the comment applies to

startSide.description: For multi-line comments, the starting side of the diff that the comment applies to. LEFT indicates the previous state, RIGHT indicates the new state

subjectType.description: The level at which the comment is targeted

add_issue_comment.name: add_issue_comment
add_issue_comment.description: Add a comment to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

add_sub_issue.name: add_sub_issue
add_sub_issue.description: Add a sub-issue to a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

replace_parent.description: When true, replaces the sub-issue's current parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to add. ID is not the same as issue number

assign_copilot_to_issue.name: assign_copilot_to_issue
assign_copilot_to_issue.description:
Assign Copilot to a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

This tool can help with the following outcomes:
- a Pull Request created with source code changes to resolve the issue


More information can be found at:
- https://docs.github.com/en/copilot/using-github-copilot/using-copilot-coding-agent-to-work-on-tasks/about-assigning-tasks-to-copilot

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

create_and_submit_pull_request_review.name: create_and_submit_pull_request_review
create_and_submit_pull_request_review.description: Create and submit a review for a pull request without review comments.

create_branch.name: create_branch
create_branch.description: Create a new branch in a GitHub repository

content.description: Content for simple single-file gist creation

filename.description: Filename for simple single-file gist creation

create_issue.name: create_issue
create_issue.description: Create a new issue in a GitHub repository.

assignees.description: Usernames to assign to this issue

labels.description: Labels to apply to this issue

create_or_update_file.name: create_or_update_file
create_or_update_file.description: Create or update a single file in a GitHub repository. If updating, you must provide the SHA of the file you want to update. Use this tool to create or update a file in a GitHub repository remotely; do not use it for local file operations.

branch.description: Branch to create/update the file in

path.description: Path where to create/update the file

sha.description: Required if updating an existing file. The blob SHA of the file being replaced.

create_pending_pull_request_review.name: create_pending_pull_request_review
create_pending_pull_request_review.description: Create a pending review for a pull request. Call this first before attempting to add comments to a pending review, and ultimately submitting it. A pending pull request review means a pull request review, it is pending because you create it first and submit it later, and the PR author will not see it until it is submitted.

create_pull_request.name: create_pull_request
create_pull_request.description: Create a new pull request in a GitHub repository.

create_pull_request_with_copilot.name: create_pull_request_with_copilot
create_pull_request_with_copilot.description: Delegate a task to GitHub Copilot coding agent to perform in the background. The agent will create a pull request with the implementation. You should use this tool if the user asks to create a pull request to perform a specific task, or if the user asks Copilot to do something.

base_ref.description: Git reference (e.g., branch) that the agent will start its work from. If not specified, defaults to the repository's default branch

owner.description: Repository owner. You can guess the owner, but confirm it with the user before proceeding.

problem_statement.description: Detailed description of the task to be performed (e.g., 'Implement a feature that does X', 'Fix bug Y', etc.)

repo.description: Repository name. You can guess the repository name, but confirm it with the user before proceeding.

title.description: Title for the pull request that will be created

create_repository.name: create_repository
create_repository.description: Create a new GitHub repository in your account or specified organization

organization.description: Organization to create the repository in (omit to create in your personal account)

delete_file.name: delete_file
delete_file.description: Delete a file from a GitHub repository

branch.description: Branch to delete the file from

path.description: Path to the file to delete

delete_pending_pull_request_review.name: delete_pending_pull_request_review
delete_pending_pull_request_review.description: Delete the requester's latest pending pull request review. Use this after the user decides not to submit a pending review, if you don't know if they already created one then check first.

delete_workflow_run_logs.name: delete_workflow_run_logs
delete_workflow_run_logs.description: Delete logs for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

dismiss_notification.name: dismiss_notification
dismiss_notification.description: Dismiss a notification by marking it as read or done

state.description: The new state of the notification (read/done)

threadID.description: The ID of the notification thread

download_workflow_run_artifact.name: download_workflow_run_artifact
download_workflow_run_artifact.description: Get download URL for a workflow run artifact

artifact_id.description: The unique identifier of the artifact

fork_repository.name: fork_repository
fork_repository.description: Fork a GitHub repository to your account or specified organization

get_code_scanning_alert.name: get_code_scanning_alert
get_code_scanning_alert.description: Get details of a specific code scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

get_commit.name: get_commit
get_commit.description: Get details for a commit from a GitHub repository

include_diff.description: Whether to include file diffs and stats in the response. Default is true.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch name, or tag name

get_dependabot_alert.name: get_dependabot_alert
get_dependabot_alert.description: Get details of a specific dependabot alert in a GitHub repository.

get_discussion.name: get_discussion
get_discussion.description: Get a specific discussion by ID

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_file_contents.name: get_file_contents
get_file_contents.description: Get the contents of a file or directory from a GitHub repository

path.description: Path to file/directory (directories must end with a slash '/')

ref.description: Accepts optional git refs such as `refs/tags/{tag}`, `refs/heads/{branch}` or `refs/pull/{pr_number}/head`

sha.description: Accepts optional commit SHA. If specified, it will be used instead of ref

get_issue.name: get_issue
get_issue.description: Get details of a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

get_issue_comments.name: get_issue_comments
get_issue_comments.description: Get comments for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_job_logs.name: get_job_logs
get_job_logs.description: Download logs for a specific workflow job or efficiently get all failed job logs for a workflow run

failed_only.description: When true, gets logs for all failed jobs in run_id

job_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow job (required for single job logs)

return_content.description: Returns actual log content instead of URLs

run_id.description: Workflow run ID (required when using failed_only)

tail_lines.description: Number of lines to return from the end of the log

get_latest_release.name: get_latest_release
get_latest_release.description: Get the latest release in a GitHub repository

get_me.name: get_me
get_me.description: Get details of the authenticated GitHub user. Use this when a request is about the user's own profile for GitHub. Or when information is missing to build other tool calls.

get_notification_details.name: get_notification_details
get_notification_details.description: Get detailed information for a specific GitHub notification, always call this tool when the user asks for details about a specific notification, if you don't know the ID list notifications first.

get_pull_request.name: get_pull_request
get_pull_request.description: Get details of a specific pull request in a GitHub repository.

get_pull_request_diff.name: get_pull_request_diff
get_pull_request_diff.description: Get the diff of a pull request.

get_pull_request_files.name: get_pull_request_files
get_pull_request_files.description: Get the files changed in a specific pull request.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

get_pull_request_review_comments.name: get_pull_request_review_comments
get_pull_request_review_comments.description: Get pull request review comments. They are comments made on a portion of the unified diff during a pull request review. These are different from commit comments and issue comments in a pull request.

get_pull_request_reviews.name: get_pull_request_reviews
get_pull_request_reviews.description: Get reviews for a specific pull request.

get_pull_request_status.name: get_pull_request_status
get_pull_request_status.description: Get the status of a specific pull request.

get_release_by_tag.name: get_release_by_tag
get_release_by_tag.description: Get a specific release by its tag name in a GitHub repository

get_secret_scanning_alert.name: get_secret_scanning_alert
get_secret_scanning_alert.description: Get details of a specific secret scanning alert in a GitHub repository.

get_tag.name: get_tag
get_tag.description: Get details about a specific git tag in a GitHub repository

get_team_members.name: get_team_members
get_team_members.description: Get member usernames of a specific team in an organization. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

org.description: Organization login (owner) that contains the team.

get_teams.name: get_teams
get_teams.description: Get details of the teams the user is a member of. Limited to organizations accessible with current credentials

user.description: Username to get teams for. If not provided, uses the authenticated user.

get_workflow_run.name: get_workflow_run
get_workflow_run.description: Get details of a specific workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

get_workflow_run_logs.name: get_workflow_run_logs
get_workflow_run_logs.description: Download logs for a specific workflow run (EXPENSIVE: downloads ALL logs as ZIP. Consider using get_job_logs with failed_only=true for debugging failed jobs)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

get_workflow_run_usage.name: get_workflow_run_usage
get_workflow_run_usage.description: Get usage metrics for a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_branches.name: list_branches
list_branches.description: List branches in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_code_scanning_alerts.name: list_code_scanning_alerts
list_code_scanning_alerts.description: List code scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

ref.description: The Git reference for the results you want to list.

severity.description: Filter code scanning alerts by severity

state.description: Filter code scanning alerts by state. Defaults to open

tool_name.description: The name of the tool used for code scanning.

list_commits.name: list_commits
list_commits.description: Get list of commits of a branch in a GitHub repository. Returns at least 30 results per page by default, but can return more if specified using the perPage parameter (up to 100).

author.description: Author username or email address to filter commits by

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sha.description: Commit SHA, branch or tag name to list commits of. If not provided, uses the default branch of the repository. If a commit SHA is provided, will list commits up to that SHA.

list_dependabot_alerts.name: list_dependabot_alerts
list_dependabot_alerts.description: List dependabot alerts in a GitHub repository.

state.description: Filter dependabot alerts by state. Defaults to open

list_discussion_categories.name: list_discussion_categories
list_discussion_categories.description: List discussion categories with their id and name, for a repository or organisation.

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussion categories will be queried at the organisation level.

list_discussions.name: list_discussions
list_discussions.description: List discussions for a repository or organisation.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

category.description: Optional filter by discussion category ID. If provided, only discussions with this category are listed.

orderBy.description: Order discussions by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Repository name. If not provided, discussions will be queried at the organisation level.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

since.description: Only gists updated after this time (ISO 8601 timestamp)

username.description: GitHub username (omit for authenticated user's gists)

list_global_security_advisories.name: list_global_security_advisories
list_global_security_advisories.description: List global security advisories from GitHub.

affects.description: Filter advisories by affected package or version (e.g. "package1,package2@1.0.0").

cwes.description: Filter by Common Weakness Enumeration IDs (e.g. ["79", "284", "22"]).

ghsaId.description: Filter by GitHub Security Advisory ID (format: GHSA-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx).

isWithdrawn.description: Whether to only return withdrawn advisories.

modified.description: Filter by publish or update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

published.description: Filter by publish date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

updated.description: Filter by update date or date range (ISO 8601 date or range).

list_issue_types.name: list_issue_types
list_issue_types.description: List supported issue types for repository owner (organization).

owner.description: The organization owner of the repository

list_issues.name: list_issues
list_issues.description: List issues in a GitHub repository. For pagination, use the 'endCursor' from the previous response's 'pageInfo' in the 'after' parameter.

after.description: Cursor for pagination. Use the endCursor from the previous page's PageInfo for GraphQL APIs.

direction.description: Order direction. If provided, the 'orderBy' also needs to be provided.

orderBy.description: Order issues by field. If provided, the 'direction' also needs to be provided.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

state.description: Filter by state, by default both open and closed issues are returned when not provided

list_notifications.name: list_notifications
list_notifications.description: Lists all GitHub notifications for the authenticated user, including unread notifications, mentions, review requests, assignments, and updates on issues or pull requests. Use this tool whenever the user asks what to work on next, requests a summary of their GitHub activity, wants to see pending reviews, or needs to check for new updates or tasks. This tool is the primary way to discover actionable items, reminders, and outstanding work on GitHub. Always call this tool when asked what to work on next, what is pending, or what needs attention in GitHub.

before.description: Only show notifications updated before the given time (ISO 8601 format)

filter.description: Filter notifications to, use default unless specified. Read notifications are ones that have already been acknowledged by the user. Participating notifications are those that the user is directly involved in, such as issues or pull requests they have commented on or created.

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are listed.

since.description: Only show notifications updated after the given time (ISO 8601 format)

list_org_repository_security_advisories.name: list_org_repository_security_advisories
list_org_repository_security_advisories.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub organization.

list_pull_requests.name: list_pull_requests
list_pull_requests.description: List pull requests in a GitHub repository. If the user specifies an author, then DO NOT use this tool and use the search_pull_requests tool instead.

head.description: Filter by head user/org and branch

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_releases.name: list_releases
list_releases.description: List releases in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_repository_security_advisories.name: list_repository_security_advisories
list_repository_security_advisories.description: List repository security advisories for a GitHub repository.

list_secret_scanning_alerts.name: list_secret_scanning_alerts
list_secret_scanning_alerts.description: List secret scanning alerts in a GitHub repository.

secret_type.description: A comma-separated list of secret types to return. All default secret patterns are returned. To return generic patterns, pass the token name(s) in the parameter.

direction.description: The direction to sort the results by.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

sort.description: How to sort the results. Can be either 'created' (when the repository was starred) or 'updated' (when the repository was last pushed to).

username.description: Username to list starred repositories for. Defaults to the authenticated user.

list_sub_issues.name: list_sub_issues
list_sub_issues.description: List sub-issues for a specific issue in a GitHub repository.

per_page.description: Number of results per page (max 100, default: 30)

list_tags.name: list_tags
list_tags.description: List git tags in a GitHub repository

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

list_workflow_jobs.name: list_workflow_jobs
list_workflow_jobs.description: List jobs for a specific workflow run

filter.description: Filters jobs by their completed_at timestamp

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_workflow_run_artifacts.name: list_workflow_run_artifacts
list_workflow_run_artifacts.description: List artifacts for a workflow run

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run

list_workflow_runs.name: list_workflow_runs
list_workflow_runs.description: List workflow runs for a specific workflow

actor.description: Returns someone's workflow runs. Use the login for the user who created the workflow run.

branch.description: Returns workflow runs associated with a branch. Use the name of the branch.

event.description: Returns workflow runs for a specific event type

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

status.description: Returns workflow runs with the check run status

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID or workflow file name

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

manage_notification_subscription.name: manage_notification_subscription
manage_notification_subscription.description: Manage a notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete a notification thread subscription.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the notification subscription.

notificationID.description: The ID of the notification thread.

manage_repository_notification_subscript.name: manage_repository_notification_subscription
manage_repository_notification_subscript.description: Manage a repository notification subscription: ignore, watch, or delete repository notifications subscription for the provided repository.

action.description: Action to perform: ignore, watch, or delete the repository notification subscription.

owner.description: The account owner of the repository.

lastReadAt.description: Describes the last point that notifications were checked (optional). Default: Now

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only notifications for this repository are marked as read.

merge_pull_request.name: merge_pull_request
merge_pull_request.description: Merge a pull request in a GitHub repository.

push_files.name: push_files
push_files.description: Push multiple files to a GitHub repository in a single commit

files.description: Array of file objects to push, each object with path (string) and content (string)

remove_sub_issue.name: remove_sub_issue
remove_sub_issue.description: Remove a sub-issue from a parent issue in a GitHub repository.

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to remove. ID is not the same as issue number

reprioritize_sub_issue.name: reprioritize_sub_issue
reprioritize_sub_issue.description: Reprioritize a sub-issue to a different position in the parent issue's sub-issue list.

after_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized after (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

before_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to be prioritized before (either after_id OR before_id should be specified)

issue_number.description: The number of the parent issue

sub_issue_id.description: The ID of the sub-issue to reprioritize. ID is not the same as issue number

request_copilot_review.name: request_copilot_review
request_copilot_review.description: Request a GitHub Copilot code review for a pull request. Use this for automated feedback on pull requests, usually before requesting a human reviewer.

rerun_failed_jobs.name: rerun_failed_jobs
rerun_failed_jobs.description: Re-run only the failed jobs in a workflow run

run_id.description: The unique identifier of the workflow run
The unique identifier of the workflow run

run_workflow.name: run_workflow
run_workflow.description: Run an Actions workflow by workflow ID or filename

ref.description: The git reference for the workflow. The reference can be a branch or tag name.

workflow_id.description: The workflow ID (numeric) or workflow file name (e.g., main.yml, ci.yaml)

search_code.name: search_code
search_code.description: Fast and precise code search across ALL GitHub repositories using GitHub's native search engine. Best for finding exact symbols, functions, classes, or specific code patterns.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub's powerful code search syntax. Examples: 'content:Skill language:Java org:github', 'NOT is:archived language:Python OR language:go', 'repo:github/github-mcp-server'. Supports exact matching, language filters, path filters, and more.

search_issues.name: search_issues
search_issues.description: Search for issues in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:issue

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only issues for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub issues search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only issues for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

search_orgs.name: search_orgs
search_orgs.description: Find GitHub organizations by name, location, or other organization metadata. Ideal for discovering companies, open source foundations, or teams.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Organization search query. Examples: 'microsoft', 'location:california', 'created:>=2025-01-01'. Search is automatically scoped to type:org.

search_pull_requests.name: search_pull_requests
search_pull_requests.description: Search for pull requests in GitHub repositories using issues search syntax already scoped to is:pr

owner.description: Optional repository owner. If provided with repo, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Search query using GitHub pull request search syntax

repo.description: Optional repository name. If provided with owner, only pull requests for this repository are listed.

sort.description: Sort field by number of matches of categories, defaults to best match

search_repositories.name: search_repositories
search_repositories.description: Find GitHub repositories by name, description, readme, topics, or other metadata. Perfect for discovering projects, finding examples, or locating specific repositories across GitHub.

minimal_output.description: Return minimal repository information (default: true). When false, returns full GitHub API repository objects.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: Repository search query. Examples: 'machine learning in:name stars:>1000 language:python', 'topic:react', 'user:facebook'. Supports advanced search syntax for precise filtering.

search_users.name: search_users
search_users.description: Find GitHub users by username, real name, or other profile information. Useful for locating developers, contributors, or team members.

perPage.description: Results per page for pagination (min 1, max 100)

query.description: User search query. Examples: 'john smith', 'location:seattle', 'followers:>100'. Search is automatically scoped to type:user.

sort.description: Sort users by number of followers or repositories, or when the person joined GitHub.

submit_pending_pull_request_review.name: submit_pending_pull_request_review
submit_pending_pull_request_review.description: Submit the requester's latest pending pull request review, normally this is a final step after creating a pending review, adding comments first, unless you know that the user already did the first two steps, you should check before calling this.

body.description: The text of the review comment

gist_id.description: ID of the gist to update

update_issue.name: update_issue
update_issue.description: Update an existing issue in a GitHub repository.

duplicate_of.description: Issue number that this issue is a duplicate of. Only used when state_reason is 'duplicate'.

state_reason.description: Reason for the state change. Ignored unless state is changed.

update_pull_request.name: update_pull_request
update_pull_request.description: Update an existing pull request in a GitHub repository.

draft.description: Mark pull request as draft (true) or ready for review (false)

reviewers.description: GitHub usernames to request reviews from

update_pull_request_branch.name: update_pull_request_branch
update_pull_request_branch.description: Update the branch of a pull request with the latest changes from the base branch.

expectedHeadSha.description: The expected SHA of the pull request's HEAD ref
